intro: Teucrium maghrebinum, commonly known as Moroccan germander, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually blue to purple in color, arranged in terminal clusters. Teucrium maghrebinum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
